items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at Milpitas Unified School District Board Room, Building 500, 1331 East Calaveras Blvd., Milpitas, CA 95035

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

items.item_details:
The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
	 
.
Student Employment -  Position Establishment  
The establishment of the following position at DO effective 11/13/12: 
Social Media Input Student Assistant, Human Resources Department
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details: A MOU currently exists between the Franklin-McKinley School District, East Side Union High School District and San JosĂŠ/Evergreen Community College District--Evergreen Valley College to be partners in a program referred to as the College Connection Academy.  These funds will be used to employ an independent contractor to serve as a meeting facilitator for the College Connection Academy leadership groups. Evergreen Valley College will serve as the fiscal agent for these funds.

items.item_details:
The curriculum proposals have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee (IPCC) acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new recommendation has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and fills a clear need not being served by existing curriculum.

AJ 114:  Terrorism
ART 040:  Ceramic Sculpture 1
ESL 322L:  ESL Skills Development Lab

ESL 334L:  ESL Skills Development Lab
ETH 031:  Contemporary Issues in Mexican American Communities
	 
Non-Credit Courses:
ESL 203:  ESL Reading Lab
ESL 204:  ESL Listening/Speaking Lab
ESL 206:   ESL Grammar Lab
ESL 207:  ESL Pronunciation Lab

items.item_details:
Contract – US National Corp DBA Jimenez Painting Company – San Jose City College General Education Buildings and Technology Center Painting Project
	 
Per the request of San Jose City College, the Program Manager initiated a public bidding process for painting contractors requesting proposals for San Jose City College General Education Buildings and Technology Center Painting Project. Bids were opened on October 23, 2012, the attached bid tabulation form indicates the bids that were received. During the evaluation of the bids, it was determined that US National Corp DBA Jimenez Painting Company was the lowest responsive and responsible bidder at $338,100. Leo’s AC Painting, the apparent low bidder at bid time, elected to withdraw their bid due to a clerical error. This bid award represents a savings of $61,900 against the planned construction budget of $400,000.
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of a contract to US National Corp DBA Jimenez Painting Company in the amount of $338,100 for the San Jose City College General Education Buildings and Technology Center Painting Project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of the contract to US National Corp DBA Jimenez Painting Company for San Jose City College General Education Buildings and Technology Center Painting Project.
items.item_text: San Jose City College General Education Buildings and Technology Center Painting Project
items.item_text_raw: 6. San Jose City College General Education Buildings and Technology Center Painting Project

items.item_details:
Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.  Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.  Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
	 
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) is required by statute to meet at least annually to review the District’s Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 bond projects plan and to ensure that bond funds are being appropriately used as authorized by the voters.  There are no penalties defined in law for failure to convene a citizens’ oversight committee; however, the spirit of the law contemplates that districts will make every reasonable effort to ensure that the committee functions at least once each year to fulfill its statutory duties.  The current CBOC convenes quarterly for meetings.
	 
Pursuant to Proposition 39, the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee is required to have a minimum of one (1) student active in a community college support group, such as student government, on the Committee.  The required seat is currently filled by a student representative from San Jose City College; however, the District would like to have one student representative per College.  Mr. Shawn Sieu-Nguyen submitted his application as student representative for Evergreen Valley College on the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee to Vice Chancellor Smith.  It is requested that Mr. Shawn Sieu-Nguyen be appointed to the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the appointment of Mr. Shawn Sieu-Nguyen as a Student Representative on the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee member for a term of two years commencing November 13, 2012.
